Art. 4.62. 
Nature of the right to conversion 
The right to request the conversion of the usufruct or the attribution of full ownership of the property referred to in Article 4.61, ¤ 7 applies to any usufruct of the surviving spouse, whether it is legal or testamentary or results from a matrimonial agreement or a contractual institution.
This right is personal and non-transferable. It may not be exercised by the creditors of the holder.
Descendants of a previous relationship of the premature spouse may not be deprived by the premature spouse of the right to apply for conversion.
The surviving spouse may not be deprived of the right to request conversion of the usufruct of the property referred to in 4.61, ¤ 7, or its attribution in full ownership.
